alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Santa Fe; Torrance (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 5:01PM MDT until June 19 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bernalillo County in central New Mexico... Northwestern Torrance County in central New Mexico... Southwestern Santa Fe County in north central New Mexico... * Until 700 PM MDT. * At 501 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over portions of the area between Torreon, Tajique, Chilili, and Edgewood. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Moriarty, Edgewood, Chilili, Escabosa, Tajique, Manzano, Manzano Mountain State Park, Torreon, Miera and Ponderosa Pines. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 185 and 205. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
